runs.comm: Amla gets on the back foot to defend one to the leg side
once again pushed onto the back foot, and this time pierces the gap to get a single
Hafeez going round to de Kock, who defends this carefully back to the bowler
doesn't take him long to deposit this long-hop from Hafeez all the way to the midwicket boundary. Seems a signature shot that one from de Kock.
back of a length and de Kock defends this watchfully back to Hafeez
spears this one in on middle as de Kock tries to squirt this away to the off side
Amla whips this back of a length ball off his pads without much difficulty
de Kock glances this length ball off his pads to run a quick single
shortish delivery shaping away as Amla punches this exquisitely off the back foot all the way to the extra-cover boundary
quicker one this time as Amla looks to defend to the leg side, but almost ends up dragging it on to the stumps
Amla is in some form as he times this back of a length ball sweetly through point for another effortless boundary. Just opens the face to pierce the gap
this one pitched a little fuller as Amla drives powerfully through the covers. One of the cover fielders is able to get a hand on it, but can't prevent the pair from taking two
de Kock gets forward to clip this through midwicket for a single
hesitates as he is about to deliver, and de Kock readjusts to work this away to the off side
de Kock has got a good bat on this one as he just powers this through extra-cover for a lovely timed drive. Had to move to the leg side in order to free up his arms to execute the shot
loopy delivery that keeps low as de Kock is able to negotiate this one without much fuss
once again employs the stutter step as Amla doesn't show his intentions with a nice tap to the leg side for one
this one comes on a bit quicker as de Kock gets this away off his pads to retain strike for the next over
with a step down the wicket de Kock is able to flay this back of a length delivery from Tanvir to the point boundary. Vital runs this for South Africa
advances down the track to this back of a length delivery, and has yet another flash, but doesn't time it as sweetly as mid-off is able to rein it in
Tanvir switches over to round the wicket, but gets this line wrong first up, with this one straying down the leg side. Umpire calls wide immediately after
with no slips in place Amla can have a go at this wide delivery outside off as he edges this behind to the vacant third man region for four
back of a length and slanting in as Amla just opens the face to run this down to third man. Too easy for South Africa in these opening exchanges. Pakistan need to tighten it up
Tanvir resumes over the wicket to the left-hander as he uses a change of pace to dupe de Kock, who is looking to get this away through midwicket
good change of pace again as Amla is able to clip this to the leg side for a quick single
Amla whips this length ball off his pads for one
the bouncer makes an early appearance as de Kock tries to pull, but the shot seems rushed as he ends up hitting the ball into the ground through the leg side
it was almost as if it was pre-ordained as de Kock gets into position quickly to pull this short one all the way to the square leg boundary. Bounces just in front of the rope. Super shot that
Junaid answers with a back of a length ball which cramps de Kock for space on the off side
bouncer again on a leg stump line as de Kock tries to pull this again, but doesn't get a sweet connection on it. Still able to run a single though as the ball travels to the leg side
pure class from Amla as he unfurls a silky punch through the covers which just has enough gas on it to reach the boundary, despite one of the cover fielders in hot pursuit
and he begins with a lovely flighted delivery which is respected by de Kock with a front foot defence
loopy delivery again and just turning away as de Kock tries to find space on the off side
slightly quicker this one as de Kock gets into position to clip this to the leg side for a single
Amla calmly turns this away to the leg side to get de Kock back on strike
flighted again, but on a leg stump line, as de Kock is able to get it away without much difficulty
Amla works this leg side ball on a length towards midwicket to retain strike for the next over
nice full delivery to kick off his spell as Amla drives this elegantly to long-on
short one from Bhatti, but going down the leg side, as de Kock glances this one behind for one
this one slightly wide outside off as Amla just drills this to point
Amla too quick into his shot as he looks for the pull, but the ball had not arrived just yet
Bhatti shows his pace off with a nice 140 kph bouncer which Amla bows under. The umpire, however, is not fooled as he calls it wide because of height
back of a length outside off which is punched to cover by Amla
short once again as de Kock goes for the pull behind square, but doesn't get a good connection on it, as the ball rolls limply towards fine leg

how prophetic am I? as soon as I type that and de Kock foolishly gives up his start with a slog-sweep that carries all the way to Nasir Jamshed at deep fine leg, who completes a smart, rolling take. Wicket against the run of play, and Afridi has a glorious start to his spell, with the trademark "star man" celebration on show
fires this one in on leg as Amla tries to get this away to the leg side
fired in once more and Amla is staunch in defence
drifts this one towards middle on a length as Amla guides this towards extra-cover to get Faf on strike
drifts this in on middle as Faf shows Cape Town his organised front foot defence
quicker one once more as Faf chips this behind square on the leg side to get off the mark
Faf leans into a drive through cover and sets off immediately for the single. Amla, running to the danger end at the striker's, is able to get in and beat the throw in time
back of a length and tailing in as Amla gets tall to play this under his eyes through the off side
lovely drive off the back foot, on the rise, as Faf is able to pierce the gap on the off side
slower ball bouncer going to the leg side as Amla checks his pull shot to hit this into the ground on the leg side
Bhatti then fires in a quick bouncer, a la Andy Roberts, to which Faf leaves alone
spears this one in on leg as Faf tries to help it around the corner, but the ball instead hit his left pad. The pair still run a leg-bye though
fuller length ball on middle as Faf just works this away
flighted and coming in on middle as Amla just guides this comfortably to midwicket
back of a length and heading leg side as Faf advances down the track to time this just well enough down to midwicket in order to run two. Ran the first one hard and played with soft hands

Faf takes the bait as Afridi throws up a back of a length ball, with Faf playing a short-arm pull which he hits all the way to deep midwicket, who dives forward to complete the catch. Faf was walking back but the umpire has called him back just to check if the catch had been taken cleanly. Hafeez appears to have taken this, but the third umpire has not yet given it. Now it is out so that's that...
Amla punches this towards extra-cover for one
drifted in on off as AB is able to guide this towards cover to get off the mark
with that classic stutter step before delivering, Hafeez pitches this on a length, and AB just guides this down to long-on
speared in on Amla's pads as he whips this towards square leg
opens up his stance to cut away this wide ball outside off to beat short third man and backward point to the boundary for four
AB in a hurry early on as he steps down to drive this to deep midwicket. Runs the first one hard and is able to get back for the second with ease
unable to find any space to play this as he just hits this back to Hafeez
steps outside leg to open up the off side as he drills this, and I mean drills this through extra-cover with a sizzling drive. The Cape Town crowd enjoyed that one thoroughly
back of a length and coming in as Amla just plays this towards the covers
this one slightly quicker on middle and leg as AB works this away to the leg side
back of a length and Amla able to guide this down to extra-cover for one

Afridi strikes again, and he takes a big one as AB just plays all around this one, in an attempt to create room by stepping outside leg stump, and just misreads the line as the ball castles the off stump. Three down now and South Africa still have a lot to do with just over half the overs being played
able to find enough room on off stump to just cut this away
slightly fuller this time on the same line as Amla is able to play this away to the leg side
able to clip this leg side delivery for one
flights this on and around off as JP drives this down to long-off
length ball which is guided down to short third man. The pair run very hard in order to just make their ground
JP dances down the track to try and get this away to the leg side, but the turn on the ball means the ball ends up popping to the off side, and uppishly too. Lucky to miss the fielders there
single to the leg side
JP whips this one off his pads to retain strike for the next over
and JP goes for the big shot down the ground, and it works. This one too full from Afridi as he lofts this to the straight boundary for a six
and now JP shows off his reverse sweep, but it was to a dangerous line on middle and off, as he hits this straight to short third man
Amla gets on the back foot to whip this away to midwicket and give strike to Duminy
spears this one wide outside off as JP is able to squirt it away to sweeper cover. The pair run hard enough to complete two
JP turns this full length ball towards mid-on for one
and the first positive shot from Amla in a while as he lofts this elegantly with a lean towards extra-cover, and hits it well enough to beat long-off, who was set back at the boundary, to the rope
wide, loopy yorker that JP just eschews through the off side for one
back of a length outside off as Amla flashes at this hard all the way to sweeper cover
tries out JP with the bouncer, which JP backs away to
slower back of a length delivery which JP deftly glides down to third man
pitches back of a length and stays really low off the wicket as it thuds into Amla's pads. Pakistan make a hopeful appeal, but this was always outside the line
and Bilawal fires in yet another bouncer, but because he had bowled the previous bouncer in the over, this one has been no-balled for height
inswinging yorker fired in on leg as Amla just keeps this out. It was quick at 141 kph. Brought back memories of Waqar there
drifting on leg as Amla glances to the leg side
fullish length ball which JP drills down to long-on

back of a length and Ajmal has his man. Amla, looking to lift this leg side delivery with a slog-sweep over the fine leg boundary, instead finds the man at deep square, who is positioned well enough to get under it and complete the catch. Huge wicket in terms of the circumstances as Amla looked to keep this going till the end. South Africa will need some dashers to have a crack at the required rate now
Miller able to get off strike first ball with a nice whip to the leg side
drifts this on the pads as JP eases this behind square on the leg side
back of a length once more as Miller works this off his pads for one
low full toss just outside off as Miller drills this to sweeper cover. The pair run hard enough in order to complete two. Well run that from South Africa
fired in on leg as Miller glances this behind square for one
slower bouncer this time from Bhatti as JP checks his pull shot to get this away to the leg side
right in on the blockhole as Miller squirts this away to the off side
yorker on middle and leg as JP is able to eke this out behind square on the leg side
just outside off yorker which Miller is simply unable to get away as the keeper collects it
JP drills this full length delivery straight to extra-cover
drags this one down the leg side as JP is on to this like a flash, executing a short-arm pull with enough weight to get over the square boundary
JP then shows off his deftness with a glide to the off side to get off strike
Ajmal follows Miller as he backs away outside leg to try and make room on the off side. This one speared in on leg, leaving Miller no options

JP steps away to create room as he pummels this over the long-on boundary for what appears a six, but the umpires are having a tete-a-tete to confirm that. Great effort from the long-on fielder to dive fully to his right to have a go. Ends up being signalled four by the umpire

Ajmal fires it in once more as JP backs away. However, JP hits this one straight up, but is lucky to find no-mans land as the long-off fielder decides to let it fall just ahead of him to prevent any undue runs
and JP greets him with a lofted four through extra-cover. Too full that one from Junaid
bowls a wide full toss which JP should have done more with it as he blitzes this straight to sweeper cover
bowls this one wide outside off as Miller tries in vain to reach it. Umpire calls it a wide, much to the dismay of Junaid and keeper Umar Akmal
Miller you beauty! gives himself a little bit of room to hit the flattest of sixes that travels like a bullet to the extra-cover fence. Excellent shot!

fires in a bouncer this time, with Miller looking to pull over midwicket, but instead gets an outside edge which goes into the lights, and falls near mid-on. Afridi was lost there and couldn't get to it as he had trouble sighting the ball
another bouncer and this time JP has a go as he pulls this uppishly all the way behind to fine leg
too wide outside off as JP lofts this elegantly through the extra-cover region, and just has enough gas on it to reach the boundary. What an over for South Africa with 19 runs coming off it
starts off with a slower one which Miller, already rushed into his shot, can only French cut it behind for one
low full toss and slanting away as JP gets his bat on it to guide it in front of point
this time fires in a yorker on leg as all Miller can do is whip it off his pads
low full toss again as JP only succeeds at drilling straight to Afridi at mid-off. Excellent over so far from Tanvir
fired in on off this time as Miller can only find point, but when the throw comes in at the non-strikers, with no one backing up, the pair run the extra

while the result was a four it was again a lovely delivery on off stump as Tanvir does the job to give Pakistan a much-needed victory against South Africa finally. This was drilled to point, but was hit at such a rate of knots that it burst through the hands and went all the way to the boundary. But Pakistan don't mind as they square up the series with South Africa, and go up to fourth place
